alert.note: Alert for Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 1:05AM EST until February 18 at 5:03PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Ohio... Nimishillen Creek Near North Industry affecting Stark County. For the Nimishillen Creek...including North Industry...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nimishillen Creek Near North Industry. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Widespread flooding in southern portions of Canton from Ridge Avenue north to Allenford Drive. Flood waters cut off access to homes along Cheyenne Street and Allenford Drive. Flood waters cut off access to properties on Cleveland Southwest Avenue. Some low lying properties inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 AM EST Friday was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 02/28/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning by 1115 AM EST.
